Description: False door: this block is the upper part only of the false door of Khnumhotep. It is carved in very fine low relief with much good detail in the hieroglyphs. The two lines of text on the lintel contain a standard invocation-formula; the texts on the jambs and drum contain the titles and dignities of Khnumhotep. The left and right upper corners have suffered some.damage and a numbeTof signs are slightly damaged. No colour remains.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p. 166; Part 2, p. 578.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.18)
Condition: Incomplete - upper part only. The left and right upper corners have suffered some.damage and a numbeTof signs are slightly damaged. Otherwise the state is good.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
